org.spongepowered.api.world.gen

Interface WorldGenerator


  • public interface WorldGenerator
    Represents the world generator of a world. This interface contains all settings for the world generator, like which populators are in use, but also the world seed.

    The generation process for chunks is divided into two phases, generation and population. The generation phase is in charge of creating the base terrain shape and generating large terrain features. All operations during the generation phase act upon a BlockBuffer rather than a live chunk object.

    Conversely the population phase operates against a live chunk object and has the guarantee that all immediately surrounding chunks have at least passed the generation phase. The population phase is typically used for the placement of small features and objects placed may cross chunk boundaries.

      The generation phase:
    1. Create a BlockBuffer representing the chunk's area
    2. Call the base GeneratorPopulator from the WorldGenerator to create the base terrain shape.
    3. Call each of the GeneratorPopulators registered to the BiomeType.
    4. Call each of the GeneratorPopulators registered to the WorldGenerator.
    5. Build the final Chunk object from the contents of the BlockBuffer.
      The population phase:
    1. Validate surrounding chunks.
    2. Using the biome at an arbitrary point within the chunk ({16, 0, 16} in the vanilla game), pass the chunk to each of the Populators registered to the chosen biome.
    3. Pass the chunk to each of the Populators registered to the WorldGenerator.

    • Method Detail

      • getBaseGeneratorPopulator

        GeneratorPopulator getBaseGeneratorPopulator()
        Gets the main GeneratorPopulator. This generator populator is responsible for generating the base terrain of the chunk.
        Returns:
        The GeneratorPopulator.
        See Also:
        setBaseGeneratorPopulator(GeneratorPopulator)

      • setBaseGeneratorPopulator

        void setBaseGeneratorPopulator(GeneratorPopulator generator)
        Sets the GeneratorPopulator. This generator populator is responsible for generating the base terrain of the chunk.
        Parameters:
        generator - The generator.

      • getGeneratorPopulators

        List<GeneratorPopulator> getGeneratorPopulators()
        Gets a mutable list of GeneratorPopulators. These populators work strictly on a single chunk. They will be executed directly after the biome ground cover layers and the biome generator populators have been called. These generator populators are typically used to generate large terrain features, like caves and ravines.

        This list does not include the base generator.

        Returns:
        The generator populators

      • getPopulators

        List<Populator> getPopulators()
        Gets a mutable list of Populators which are applied globally (in the whole world).
        Returns:
        The populators
        See Also:
        BiomeType.getPopulators()

      • getBiomeGenerator

        BiomeGenerator getBiomeGenerator()
        Gets the BiomeGenerator for this world generator.
        Returns:
        The biome generator

      • setBiomeGenerator

        void setBiomeGenerator(BiomeGenerator biomeGenerator)
        Sets the BiomeGenerator for this world generator.
        Parameters:
        biomeGenerator - The new biome generator
